meanings.definition: To remove something from a nest.
meanings.sent1: I carefully unnest the eggs from the bird's nest.
meanings.sent2: She had to unnest the twigs and leaves from the squirrel's nest.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel watched in surprise as I tried to unnest its cozy home.
meanings.sent4: With gentle hands, she unnested the fragile eggs from the nest.
meanings.sent5: The task of unnesting the tangled mess was challenging but rewarding.

meanings.definition: To remove items from a nested structure.
meanings.sent1: The programmer needed to unnest the data from the nested array.
meanings.sent2: It took hours to unnest all the boxes from within each other.
meanings.sent3: I had to unnest the Russian dolls to find the smallest one.
meanings.sent4: She carefully unnested the jewelry from the velvet-lined box.
meanings.sent5: The archaeologist had to unnest the artifacts from the layers of soil.
